page.title: 02EAST HADDON SITE
page.content:
East Haddon is situated to the North West of Northampton. It is sited on a ridge in an area of undulating grassland. The soil is a mixture of sand clay and is of largely glacial origin. This too accounts for the undulating nature of the land.
The village is sited to the North of the A428 Northampton to Rugby road.
The village is of the "Ribbon type" giving the impression of a long drawn out development.Few houses are sited off one of the four roads.
There is no river within the village.
